title: Seated Dancer

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of graphite, with touches of erasing, on ivory wove paper.

medium_display: Graphite, with touches of erasing, on ivory wove paper
inscriptions: Signed recto, lower right, in graphite: "Henri-Matisse"
credit_line: Gift of Dorothy Braude Edinburg to the Harry B. and Bessie K. Braude Memorial Collection
publication_history: New York City Ballet, 10th Anniversary American Music Festival, Apr. 26, 1988 (ill.). Suzanne Folds McCullagh (ed.), Drawings in Dialogue: Old Master Through Modern, The Harry B. and Bessie K. Braude Memorial Collection, exh. cat. (Chicago: The Art Institute of Chicago, 2006), pp. 146 and 195, cat. 144 (ill.). “Seated Dancer,” in Matisse Paintings, Works on Paper, Sculpture, and Textiles at the Art Institute of Chicago, ed. Stephanie D’Alessandro (Chicago: Art Institute of Chicago, 2019), cat. 41, https://publications.artic.edu/matisse/reader/works/section/24/24_anchor.
exhibition_history:
Probably London, M. Knoedler and Company Ltd., Exhibition of Old Master, Impressionist, and Contemporary Drawings, June 12–July 19, 1958, cat. 38, as Dancer Resting.

Cannes, La Malmaison, Matisse: La Danse, 1993, no cat. no.

The Art Institute of Chicago, Drawings in Dialogue: Old Master Through Modern, The Harry B. and Bessie K. Braude Memorial Collection, June 3–July 30, 2006, pp. 146 and 195, cat. 144 (ill.).
provenance_text: Knoedler Galleries, New York, probably by June 1958 [acc. London 1990 auct. cat.].  Allan Frumkin Gallery, New York [acc. London 1990 auct. cat.].  Harry Spiro (1924–2001), New York, by Oct. 1973.  Unidentified private collection, Chicago.  Sold by John Berggruen Gallery, San Francisco, to Hirschl and Adler Galleries, New York, by 1987; sold to Thomas Ammann Fine Art, Zurich,1987; sold to an unidentified private collection.  Sold, Sotheby’s, London, Apr. 4, 1990, lot 152, to Dorothy Braude Edinburg; given to the Art Institute of Chicago, 2013.
